Add module-info. Fixes #81.

Change currency data files. Files are now `CurrencyData.csv` and `CountryData.csv`. These can be overridden in `CurrencyDataExtension.csv` and `CountryDataExtension.csv`. Add historic EUR currencies.

Allow currencies to have 30 decimal places.

Update currencies for BY, LT, LV, SS. Fixes #68, #70, #72.
Deprecate some less-than-ideal methods.
Allow currency conversion to the same currency if the conversion factor is one. Fixes #63.
Add support for Indian number formatting (Lakh/Crore). MoneyAmountStyle extended grouping size provides enough power to output this.
Add support for different signed formats. Add appendSigned() to builder, allowing different formats for positive, zero and negative.
Add support for absolute values. Using MoneyAmountStyle, absolute (unsigned) amounts can be output.
Remove deprecated methods.
Change ZMW to 2 decimal places. Fixes #57.
Alter parameter names of CurrencyUnit constructor to better support tools that make use of the names. Fixes #54.

Ensure that a negative scale is not visible in BigMoney. This should have no impact on most users, but does change the semantics of certain methods. The rationale is to ensure that the toString() matches equals() and the internal state. Previously, BigMoney.ofScale(GBP, 100, 0) and BigMoney.ofScale(GBP, 1, -2) were not equal but had the same toString() (in violation of VALJO rules). Now, they are both normalized to the first form - no negative scale. Fixes #52.
Change COP to 2 decimal places. Fixes #48.
Fix bugs in formatting with MoneyAmountStyle. Fixes #43.
Change ZMK currency to ZMW. Fixes #41.
Change CNY to 2 decimal places. Fixes #40.
Close resources after loading. Fixes #39.
Allow zero to many spaces when using standard parse method. Fixes #35.
Ensure validation of string currency code. Fixes #31, #36.
Fix Javadoc of BigMoney.withScale. Fixes #31.
